slides.heading: SMU Libraries Spaces 0.0.1
slides.content: Spaces introduces SMU Librariesâ€™ two branches -- Li Ka Shing Library and Kwa Geok Choo Law Library -- through photos and quick facts.

slides.heading: How to use this app
slides.content:
[Navigation]

[Add to Home screen (Android only)]

[Offline mode (Android and Windows only)]

[Send feedback]

slides.title: Li Ka Shing Library
slides.caption: The Li Ka Shing Library building has unique architectural features that let in abundant natural light. Greenery cascades down the library's modern, curvilinear facade.
SMU Libraries has more than 380,000 printed and electronic books, 80,000 print and electronic journals, 160 eletronic databases and 17,000 SMU research publications.
Li Ka Shing library has a seating capacity of 1,800.

slides.title: Investment Studio
slides.caption: The Investment Studio is a dedicated space for accessing high-end financial databases, including Bloomberg, Eikon, Capital IQ, amongst others.
Users can hone their technical skills in business research in a professional environment.

slides.title: Hive
slides.caption: The Hive is specially designed to support active group learning. It is usually open for student use but it can be reserved for lessons and events.
It has flexible seating and five inter-connected projection screens. The space can accommodate 50.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: The Learning Commons is a 24-hour study space that caters to both group and individual learning.
Floor-to-ceiling windows look out to the Campus Green for those seeking inspiration.
A mix of booth tables, group seating and individual carrels cater to different learning styles.

slides.title: Learning Labs
slides.caption: Learning Labs 1 and 2 in the Li Ka Shing Library are equipped with video-conferencing technology and flexible furniture.
The Learning Labs are usually open for student use but they can be reserved for meetings, lessons or events. The tables can be configured for different group sizes.

slides.title: Lounge
slides.caption: The Lounge area offers popular books, DVDs, magazines and newspapers (and sometimes Smoo Smoo) in a comfortable setting.

slides.title: DVD Collection
slides.caption: Cheaper and better than Netflix Singapore.

slides.title: Lifestyle Collection
slides.caption: The Lifestyle collection includes award-winning titles, travel guides, popular non-fiction and Singapore literature.
Relax in the Lounge with a newspaper and a cuppa (with a lid).

slides.title: Graduate Lounge/Suite
slides.caption: The Graduate Lounge and Suite are study areas exclusive to postgraduate students.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge/Suite
slides.caption: The Graduate Lounge promotes collaborative learning and the exchange of ideas.

slides.title: Rooftop Garden
slides.caption: The rooftop garden offers space for relaxation and contemplation. Please do not smoke here.
View of the Singapore Art Museum dome and Rochor area in the distance.
View of the National Museum of Singapore. In the background, Orchard Road.

slides.title: Study Booths
slides.caption: Study Booths with LCD screens are located on Level 3...

slides.title: Study Booths
slides.caption: ... and Level 4.
Booths can be booked online for project discussion and presentation rehearsals.

slides.title: Kwa Geok Choo Law Library
slides.caption: Named after the late Mdm Kwa Geok Choo, the Kwa Geok Choo Law Library building opened its doors as Singapore Management University's second library on 3 January 2017 and was officially launched by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on 15 March 2017.

slides.title: Atrium
slides.caption: The atrium offers a variety of casual study spaces for users to enjoy.

The library displays the latest arrivals on shelves that students can browse at leisure. There is also a collection of faculty publications on display - note that these books are not for loan or browsing.
The library has seating space for approximately 500 users.

slides.title: Learning Commons
slides.caption: A 24/7 study space offered by the library for those wanting to keep working after library opening hours.
The Learning Commons can seat about 100.
The Learning Commons is accessible just outside of the library as well as from within the School of Law.

slides.title: Graduate Lounge
slides.caption: Kwa Geok Choo Law Library provides a Graduate Lounge exclusively for graduate students.
There is a dedicated meeting room for graduates to use for group discussions. This room is not bookable on the online system.
Mid-assignment brooding.

slides.title: Project Rooms
slides.caption: 13 project roooms can be booked by undergraduate and graduate students for group study and discussion. The orange couches have built-in power outlets.
The rooms are equipped with screens that support wireless projection from multiple devices simultaneously.

slides.title: Level 4
slides.caption: There is a spacious quiet area on level 4 where students can study while overlooking the park.

slides.title: Level 4
slides.caption: The law collection is located on level 4 and consists of textbooks, law reports and international legal journals. Kwa Geok Choo Law Library hosts a print collection of 21,000 volumes.

slides.title: Level 4
slides.caption: Personal study carrels offer users a cosy space to curl up in.

slides.title: Level 5
slides.caption: Level 5 is a quiet study space for users at the top of the dome.

slides.title: Level 5
slides.caption: There are individual study carrels too.

slides.title: Level 5
slides.caption: We have all kinds of tables for all kinds of people.

slides.title: Terrace
slides.caption: The terrace is accessible from 8.00 am to 7.30 pm for those who need a little bit of fresh air.
You can admire the view of Fort Canning Park here.
